name: Gabry Ponte
description:
'''Gabriele''' "'''Gabry'''" '''Ponte''' ({{IPA|it|ɡabriˈɛːle ˈɡaːbri ˈponte}}; born 20 April 1973) is an Italian musician, DJ and producer, best known as a member of [[Eiffel 65]].

With Eiffel 65's rise to fame in the late 1990s, he later went on to produce the Italian hit singles "[[Geordie (ballad)#Other versions|Geordie]]", "[[Time to Rock]]", "Got to Get", and "La Danza delle Streghe", along with a number of [[remixes]] of popular songs. In 2005, Ponte announced he would be separating from Eiffel 65 to pursue solo work. In 2006 he founded and still manages record label Dance and Love. He also produced the 2012 international hit "[[Tacata']]" by dance music trio [[Tacabro]], and released his singles "[[Beat on My Drum]]" (featuring [[Pitbull (rapper)|Pitbull]] and Sophia del Carmen) and "Buonanotte Giorno". He represented {{Esccnty|San Marino|y=2025}} in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2025]] with his song "[[Tutta l'Italia]]", in which he qualified for the Grand Final and placed 26th (last) with 27 points.

He entered the Top 100 DJs list from ''[[DJ Magazine|DJ Mag]]'' as of 2014.
